title.title: Measurement of Separate Cosmic-Ray Electron and Positron Spectra with the Fermi Large Area Telescope

misc: In: Phys. Rev. Lett. 108.1 (Jan. 2012), p. 011103 url: (visited on 12/20/) (see pp. 60, 258)

abstracts.value: The AMS-02 experiment is a particle detector installed on the International Space Station (ISS) since May 2011, which measures the characteristics of the cosmic rays to bring answers to the problematics risen by the astroparticle physics since a few decades, in particular the study of dark matter and the search of antimatter. The phenomenological aspects of the physics of cosmic rays are reviewed in a first part.

titles.title: Performance of the Electromagnetic Calorimeter of AMS-02 on the International Space Station ans measurement of the positronic fraction in the 1.5 – 350 GeV energy range

abstracts.value:

study is conducted to identify the Ke2 and Ke3 decays in the NA62 experiment.
